label: 藤原惺窩
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1561-1619)  The key figure in both the diffusion of Chu Hsi's thought and the establishment of its independence from Buddhism.  [He] came to be regarded as the founder of early modern Japanese Confucianism (p. 402).  [朱子学]
